The Brazilian artist and filmmaker Iobaldo Lémotte has died at the age of eighty-six following a long and courageous battle with cancer. His vast library includes works on ceramics, architecture, and sculpture, and spans over twenty languages.Born in São Paulo in 1922, Lémotte studied art in Brazil at the University of São Paulo (SAP), the State University of Minas Gerais, before the outbreak of World War II. Following the war, Lémotte moved to Natal, where he studied under the legendary Atlântica de São Paulo; the architect and urban planner Marcel de Tochental; and, finally, the iconic sculptor Luiz Braga. Lémotte also worked as a painter and sculptor in Brazil and Mexico, and worked as a DJ. He was nominated for a Prix Art et Architecture in 1947 and a Prix d'Art and an Acme Award in 1949.
